questionText: Which JavaScript method removes an element from the DOM?
reason: The remove() method deletes an element directly from the DOM.

questionText: Which method adds a new child element to a parent node?
reason: appendChild() inserts a node as the last child of a parent.

questionText: Which method clones a node including its children?
reason: cloneNode(true) creates a deep copy including child elements.

questionText: Which method prevents the default action of an event?
reason: preventDefault() stops the browser's default behavior for an event.

questionText: Which method stops an event from bubbling up the DOM tree?
reason: stopPropagation() prevents the event from propagating to parent elements.

questionText: Which JavaScript method returns the first element matching a CSS selector?
reason: querySelector() returns the first element matching the selector.

questionText: Which JavaScript method returns all elements matching a CSS selector?
reason: querySelectorAll() returns a static NodeList of all matching elements.

questionText: Which JavaScript property returns the parent node of an element?
reason: parentNode returns the immediate parent of a node.

questionText: Which JavaScript property returns the next sibling element?
reason: nextElementSibling skips text nodes and returns the next element.

questionText: Which JavaScript property returns all child nodes including text nodes?
reason: childNodes returns all child nodes including text and comment nodes.

questionText: Which JavaScript property returns only child elements?
reason: children returns only element nodes.

questionText: Which method inserts a node before a reference node?
reason: insertBefore(newNode, referenceNode) inserts before the reference.

questionText: Which JavaScript property sets inline styles of an element?
reason: The style property allows direct modification of CSS properties.

questionText: Which CSS property controls flex item growth factor?
reason: flex-grow defines how much an item will grow relative to others.

questionText: Which CSS property controls flex item shrink factor?
reason: flex-shrink defines how much an item will shrink relative to others.

questionText: Which CSS property defines initial main size of a flex item?
reason: flex-basis sets the initial size before growing or shrinking.

questionText: Which CSS property defines the order of flex items?
reason: The order property changes the visual order of flex items.

questionText: Which CSS property sets grid row start line?
reason: grid-row-start specifies which row line an element starts.

questionText: Which CSS property sets grid column end line?
reason: grid-column-end specifies which column line an element ends.

questionText: Which CSS function defines repeating grid tracks?
reason: repeat() simplifies defining multiple tracks in a grid layout.

questionText: Which JavaScript API stores key-value pairs in the browser persistently?
reason: localStorage persists data across sessions until explicitly removed.

questionText: Which JavaScript API stores key-value pairs for a single session?
reason: sessionStorage persists data only until the tab is closed.

questionText: Which JavaScript API allows structured storage of large objects?
reason: IndexedDB is a low-level API for client-side storage of significant amounts of structured data.

questionText: Which JavaScript API allows copying text to clipboard?
reason: This API writes text to the system clipboard securely.

questionText: Which method fetches resources asynchronously in JavaScript?
reason: fetch() provides a modern promise-based API to retrieve resources.

questionText: Which fetch option sets HTTP method to POST?
reason: The fetch API uses the method option to define request type.

questionText: Which fetch option sends JSON data in the body?
reason: body must be a string, so objects are stringified.

questionText: Which HTTP status code indicates successful request?
reason: 200 OK means request succeeded.

questionText: Which HTTP status code indicates resource created?
reason: 201 Created indicates successful resource creation.

questionText: Which HTTP status code indicates client error?
reason: 400-series codes indicate client errors.

questionText: Which HTTP status code indicates server error?
reason: 500-series codes indicate server errors.

questionText: Which JavaScript method sets a timer to execute a function repeatedly?
reason: setInterval() runs a function at specified intervals.

questionText: Which JavaScript method executes a function once after a delay?
reason: setTimeout() executes once after the delay.

questionText: Which property returns the viewport width in pixels?
reason: innerWidth returns the viewport width in pixels.

questionText: Which property returns the viewport height in pixels?
reason: innerHeight returns the viewport height in pixels.

questionText: Which CSS property defines grid template rows?
reason: Defines row tracks in a grid container.

questionText: Which CSS property defines grid template columns?
reason: Defines column tracks in a grid container.

questionText: Which CSS property sets the alignment of grid items along the row axis?
reason: justify-items aligns items along the row axis inside their grid area.

questionText: Which CSS property sets the alignment of grid items along the column axis?
reason: align-items aligns items along the column axis inside their grid area.

questionText: Which event fires when the DOM is fully loaded?
reason: DOMContentLoaded fires when the HTML is parsed and DOM is ready.

questionText: Which event fires when all resources (images, CSS) are fully loaded?
reason: The load event waits for all resources to finish loading.

questionText: Which JavaScript method converts a JSON string to an object?
reason: JSON.parse() parses JSON string into a JavaScript object.

questionText: Which JavaScript method converts an object to a JSON string?
reason: JSON.stringify() serializes an object to a JSON string.

questionText: Which CSS property sets a background image?
reason: background-image sets the image for an element's background.

questionText: Which CSS property repeats background image vertically and horizontally?
reason: background-repeat defines how background images are repeated.

questionText: Which CSS property sets background image position?
reason: background-position sets where the background image is placed.

questionText: Which CSS property defines how background image scales?
reason: background-size can set cover, contain, or specific dimensions.

questionText: Which JavaScript method schedules a function to run after another completes using promises?
reason: then() runs after the promise resolves successfully.

questionText: Which JavaScript method handles rejected promises?
reason: catch() handles rejected promise errors.

questionText: Which JavaScript method executes code after promise resolves or rejects?
reason: finally() executes regardless of promise outcome.

questionText: Which JavaScript method parses a URL string into an object?
reason: The URL constructor parses a string into a URL object with properties like hostname and pathname.

questionText: Which method returns the current scroll position of the window?
reason: scrollY returns the vertical scroll position in pixels.

questionText: Which method returns the horizontal scroll position of the window?
reason: scrollX returns the horizontal scroll offset in pixels.

questionText: Which CSS property hides overflowing content with scrollbars?
reason: overflow controls how content exceeding element size is handled.

questionText: Which CSS property clips content without scrollbars?
reason: overflow: hidden hides excess content without scrollbars.

questionText: Which method smoothly scrolls the window to a position?
reason: The scroll method with behavior: 'smooth' animates scrolling.

questionText: Which CSS property sets text overflow with ellipsis?
reason: text-overflow: ellipsis displays '...' when text is too long.

questionText: Which CSS property prevents text from wrapping to a new line?
reason: white-space: nowrap forces text to stay on one line.

questionText: Which method dynamically loads a JavaScript module?
reason: import() returns a promise that resolves with the module.

questionText: Which API allows sending data over WebSocket?
reason: send() transmits data over an open WebSocket connection.

questionText: Which event fires when a WebSocket connection opens?
reason: The 'open' event signals the WebSocket is ready to send/receive data.

questionText: Which event fires when a WebSocket receives a message?
reason: The 'message' event is triggered when data is received from server.

questionText: Which event fires when a WebSocket closes?
reason: The 'close' event signals the connection has been closed.

questionText: Which method aborts an ongoing fetch request?
reason: AbortController can cancel a fetch request via a signal.

questionText: Which method converts a NodeList to an array?
reason: Array.from() creates a real array from array-like objects.

questionText: Which method removes all child nodes from an element?
reason: Setting innerHTML to empty string removes all child nodes.

questionText: Which JavaScript object holds URL query parameters?
reason: URLSearchParams parses and manages URL query strings.

questionText: Which method gets value of a query parameter?
reason: URLSearchParams.get('key') returns the value of the key.

questionText: Which method sets value of a query parameter?
reason: URLSearchParams.set('key', 'value') updates or adds a parameter.

questionText: Which API allows playing audio in the browser programmatically?
reason: Audio() creates an HTMLAudioElement to play sound files.

questionText: Which API allows playing video in the browser programmatically?
reason: Video elements can be controlled via the HTMLVideoElement API.

questionText: Which CSS property creates a stacking context for z-index?
reason: A positioned element creates a new stacking context for z-index.

questionText: Which CSS property applies multiple transforms at once?
reason: transform can combine scale, rotate, translate, etc.

questionText: Which CSS function defines a rotation?
reason: rotate(angle) rotates an element by the given angle.

questionText: Which CSS function defines scaling?
reason: scale() enlarges or shrinks elements.

questionText: Which CSS property makes an element sticky during scroll?
reason: Sticky positioning keeps the element fixed within its parent during scrolling.

questionText: Which CSS property defines animation duration?
reason: Defines how long an animation lasts.

questionText: Which CSS property defines keyframes for an animation?
reason: @keyframes defines the sequence of frames for CSS animation.

questionText: Which CSS property sets a delay before animation starts?
reason: animation-delay specifies when the animation begins.

questionText: Which CSS property defines easing for animations?
reason: animation-timing-function defines speed curve of the animation.

questionText: Which JavaScript method gets computed style of an element?
reason: Returns the final used values of all CSS properties.

questionText: Which method registers a service worker?
reason: Registers a service worker script for offline caching and background tasks.

questionText: Which method sends a message to a service worker?
reason: postMessage() sends data to a service worker.

questionText: Which API handles push notifications in browser?
reason: Push API allows server to send messages to client even when page is closed.

questionText: Which API displays system notifications to users?
reason: Notification API shows notifications outside the web page.

questionText: Which JavaScript API detects if page is visible?
reason: Page Visibility API detects if the document is visible or hidden.

questionText: Which property returns current visibility state?
reason: Returns 'visible', 'hidden', etc. to detect page state.

questionText: Which API detects network connectivity changes?
reason: navigator.connection provides info about network type and changes.

questionText: Which property gives effective type of network connection?
reason: Indicates network speed: '4g', '3g', etc.

questionText: Which API provides geolocation information?
reason: Geolocation API gets user's current location with permission.

questionText: Which method gets current position via Geolocation API?
reason: getCurrentPosition() retrieves location once.

questionText: Which method tracks position continuously via Geolocation API?
reason: watchPosition() calls a callback whenever position changes.

questionText: Which method stops watchPosition tracking?
reason: clearWatch() stops the watchPosition callback.

questionText: Which API provides vibration on supported devices?
reason: navigator.vibrate() triggers vibration pattern on device.

questionText: Which method triggers device vibration?
reason: Vibration pattern array triggers vibration and pauses sequentially.

questionText: Which API allows drag-and-drop operations in browser?
reason: The Drag and Drop API manages draggable elements and drop zones.

questionText: Which event fires when dragging starts?
reason: dragstart triggers when a draggable element begins to be dragged.

questionText: Which event fires when dragged element is over a drop target?
reason: dragover triggers repeatedly while element is over drop zone.

questionText: Which event fires when a dragged element is dropped?
reason: drop event triggers when user releases dragged element on target.

questionText: Which CSS property makes an element draggable visually?
reason: Adding draggable='true' enables element to be dragged using Drag and Drop API.
